title: NEIGHBORHOOD REPORT CIVIC GROUP TO HEAR TALK ON TERRORISM
full text:
The West Cunningham Park Civic Association will hold a general membership meeting Wednesday at Christ Lutheran Church, 73rd Ave. and 188th St.
Deputy Inspector Gary Scirica of the NYPD will speak on counterterrorism, and representatives of the 107th Precinct will be on hand. Nominations will be accepted for executive board members and officers.
The meeting begins at 8 p.m. in the church basement.
Legal tips on housing
Free information about fair housing laws, tenants' rights, homeownership and public and senior housing will be available Saturday at a Fair Housing Program sponsored by Asian Americans for Equality.
Trained counselors will be on hand to answer questions in English, Mandarin, Cantonese, Korean and some South Asian languages. The event will be held at the Flushing Mall, eShops Stage Area, 133-31 39th Ave., Flushing, from 1 p.m. to 5 p.m. Admission is free.
Board 10 will meet
Community Board 10 will meet next Thursday at 7:45 p.m. at the Knights of Columbus Hall, 135-45 Lefferts Blvd., South Ozone Park.
There will be a public hearing on a request by Causeway Amusement of Jamaica regarding permit requirements for the company's parking areas.
Hear Russian poetry
Nina Savina, a master performer in the art of reading poetry, will focus on Marina Tzvetaeva, Alexander Blok and other well-known Russian poets at two libraries next week.
On Monday, the program will be held at the Forest Hills Branch, at 108-19 71st Ave., and on Tuesday, at the Kew Gardens Hills branch, 72-33 Vleigh Place.
Both programs will be in Russian and will begin at 4:30 p.m.
Disabilities discussed
The Queens Council on Developmental Disabilities sponsors it annual Queens Legislative Breakfast tomorrow, in room 213 of Borough Hall, 120-55 Queens Blvd., Kew Gardens, from 9 a.m. to 11:30 a.m.
City and state officials will discuss concerns about the future of people with mental retardation and developmental disabilities.

Load-Date: April 24, 2003
